content: November 5, 2024 Election Readiness Toolkit | San Francisco Skip to main content English Español 中文 Filipino Menu Services Departments Search Event November 5, 2024 Election Readiness Toolkit Get ready for this election with our toolkit! Date Tuesday, November 5, 2024 Make sure your registered address is accurate and current. Before we start mailing ballots and Voter Information Pamphlets this October, check the address we have on file for you . Need to register or make changes? You can do that at registertovote.ca.gov . Start your research on candidates and measures early! The November 5 ballot will consist of four cards and have many contests! All ballots will list contests for U.S. President and Vice President, U.S. Senator, U.S. Representative, State Senator, State Assembly and measures. All ballots will also list contests for Board of Education and Community College Board Members, as well as ranked-choice voting (RCV) contests for Mayor, City Attorney, District Attorney, Sheriff, and Treasurer. Practice marking an RCV contest here! Only ballots for voters living in odd (1,3,5,7,9 and 11) supervisorial districts will list a Board of Supervisors contest, and only ballots for voters living in BART districts 7 and 9 will list a BART Board contest. Check your districts here! (The one-card ballot for non-citizen voters will list the Board of Education contest only.) Make voting easier with our online tools. Map out your voting plan. Read your Voter Information Pamphlet (PDF) . Access your Voter Information Pamphlet online. Listen to your Voter Information Pamphlet (ZIP) . Review your voting options. Track your ballot, request a new ballot, or view your sample ballot. Learn about election security. Learn about non-citizen voting . An accurate and complete vote count takes time!
